intro: Begonia glauca, commonly known as the blue begonia, is a herbaceous perennial native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in partial shade with well-draining soil. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy coating, giving them a distinctive glaucous appearance. Begonia glauca is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor and outdoor environments.
